page.title: 01Wolverhampton West.
page.content: The area studied stretches from central Wolverhampton to the suburban housing areas of Newbridge,Compton and Finchfield on the western edges of the town. Wolverhampton's centre consists mainly of shops and offices surrounded by a Ring Road which allows through traffic to be diverted away from the congested town and allowing pedestrianisation in the Mander Centre.Immediately beyond the Ring Road is a zone of industry and poor Victorian terraced housing,much altered or demolished,but including the attractive West Park with lake and recreation areas.Outside this zone is an area of late Victorian quality houses many changed to flats or small offices.The outer area is mostly residential and contains middle quality inter-war houses eg.Oxbarn and high quality properties eg.Compton.
